snippet: About 20 players and two on-ice officials have or are suspected of having had mumps, an illness that affects a few hundred people a year, mostly on college campuses.
abstract: Mumps outbreak in National Hockey League is not abating and about 20 players either have virus or are suspected of having it; Centers for Disease Control and Prevention says NHL's current outbreak, which is believed to have started in October, is similar in scope to other outbreaks
lead_paragraph: About 20 players and two on-ice officials have or are suspected of having had mumps, an illness that affects a few hundred people a year, mostly on college campuses.

headline.main: The Mumps, a Scourge of Dormitories, Spreads Through the N.H.L.
headline.print_headline: N.H.L.’s Mumps Outbreak Shows No Signs of Easing

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations
